tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: And since it is a book of God, it is absolutely necessary that everybody should pay heed to its warnings and gives serious thought to them. On the face of it, this is an ordinary statement consisting of just a few words
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah As-Sajdah, Ayah 4?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The gradual creation of the universe, in six days meaning six stages, along with the system full of wisdom governing it, is indicative of the fact that the Creator has some special purpose behind this creation
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Man’s creation for the first time is enough to convince mankind of the possibility of creation for the second time. But when a man does not believe in his accountability before God, he ridicules the possibility of a second creation, and he talks flippantly of it
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Such people will forever relish the bounties of the eternal Gardens of Paradise. For an individual to avail of guidance, his willingness to accept the Truth is the most important factor
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse explains the rules of inheritance

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah As-Sajdah, Ayah 18?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: A believer (mu’min ) is one who accepts the Divine Truth and a sinner (faasiq) is one who rejects it for the sake of self-protection. In the present world, one who accepts the Truth, proves that he gives prime importance to Truth
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who make innovative interpretations of religion and thus cause differences to arise, incur the risk of final rejection on the Day of judgement and thereafter experience nothing but unending denigration
distractors: This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: According to the tafsir, what should we understand from this verse?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Similarly, God’s powers can cause Islam to flourish and become the predominant ideology of the world. In ancient Makkah the polytheists were dominant, while Islam was in a very weak position, so much so that the polytheists used to ridicule Islam and Muslims
distractors: This verse only discusses worldly matters
This verse is primarily about historical events
This verse addresses only legal rulings
